title.narrative: 06-02 CHILD JUSTICE

description.narrative: 6.2. By 2021, the criminal justice system has improved child-sensitive child justice practices at all stages., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2021, children benefit from a system that ensures integrated, improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.2. By 2021, the criminal justice system has improved child-sensitive child justice practices at all stages.

description.narrative: The;draft Children’s Code Bill was aligned to international standards, the;National Juvenile Justice Strategy;was finalised and;migration policies were;upgraded. The 5th and 7th State Party Report was submitted to the Committee on the Rights of the Child. 101;juvenile;offenders;were diverted in four;pilot;districts; 95 per cent of prosecutors were trained and 922 cases ofsexual violence were;addressed in-line with standards. The Guidelines for Child;victims;and Witnesses;Protection in Judicial Processesare being rolled out in 15 districts through 115 frontline workers.;Improved police and social welfare coordination;and response;resulted;in;support to 95 international child migrants, successful;advocacy for the release of 306;international child migrants and;support to;179;children retrieved from brothels. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2022
